content:
As an AI language model, I don't have enough information about your specific situation to give a definitive answer. However, consistent exercise combined with proper form and technique can lead to improvement in back pain and posture over time.

It's important to understand that posture and back pain are often the result of years of poor habits, so it may take some time to see significant improvement. It's recommended to perform these exercises regularly, while also monitoring and adjusting your posture habits throughout the day. Additionally, it's always a good idea to consult with a medical professional, such as a physical therapist, to address any underlying issues and create a personalized exercise plan.
